distribution.text: Copyright 2024 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for ecryptfs-utils fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2016-1572: A local user could have escalated privileges by mounting over special filesystems (bsc#962052)
- CVE-2014-9687: A default salt value reduced complexity of offline precomputation attacks (bsc#920160)
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: CSAF 2.0 data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: eCryptfs 104 and earlier uses a default salt to encrypt the mount passphrase, which makes it easier for attackers to obtain user passwords via a brute force attack.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: mount.ecryptfs_private.c in eCryptfs-utils does not validate mount destination filesystem types, which allows local users to gain privileges by mounting over a nonstandard filesystem, as demonstrated by /proc/$pid.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
